metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2216 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: The HTTP header parsing code in Node.js 0.10.x before 0.10.42, 0.11.6 through 0.11.16, 0.12.x before 0.12.10, 4.x before 4.3.0, and 5.x before 5.6.0 allows remote attackers to bypass an HTTP response-splitting protection mechanism via UTF-8 encoded Unicode characters in the HTTP header, as demonstrated by %c4%8d%c4%8a.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Сковорода Никита Андреевич and Amit Klein

criterions.comment: nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
